Description: Fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery plate; completely flat, with step on underside; thin yellowish slip; decorated inside with figured zone: lion on top of an animal, both to left, below metopal frieze of billets and verticals; added red on mane and belly of lion and back of attacked animal, and on filled squares in metope band; underside decorated with broad and thin brown bands. Clay apparently without mica, but some small white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
marked in pencil 'N' and '89'. CVA Philadelphia, The University Museum (2) pl. 4,7 b. Likely to be from the same plate as BM 1965,0930.596-7 and Boston MFA 88.825.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1200)
